OpenMM::VerletIntegrator Class Reference

Detailed Description

This is an Integrator which simulates a System using the leap-frog Verlet algorithm.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

OpenMM::VerletIntegrator::VerletIntegrator ( double  stepSize) [explicit]

Create a VerletIntegrator.

Parameters:
stepSizethe step size with which to integrator the system (in picoseconds)

Member Function Documentation

void OpenMM::VerletIntegrator::cleanup ( ) [protected, virtual]

This will be called by the Context when it is destroyed to let the Integrator do any necessary cleanup. It will also get called again if the application calls reinitialize() on the Context.

Reimplemented from OpenMM::Integrator.

double OpenMM::VerletIntegrator::computeKineticEnergy ( ) [protected, virtual]

Compute the kinetic energy of the system at the current time.

Implements OpenMM::Integrator.

std::vector<std::string> OpenMM::VerletIntegrator::getKernelNames ( ) [protected, virtual]

Get the names of all Kernels used by this Integrator.

Implements OpenMM::Integrator.

void OpenMM::VerletIntegrator::initialize ( ContextImpl &  context) [protected, virtual]

This will be called by the Context when it is created. It informs the Integrator of what context it will be integrating, and gives it a chance to do any necessary initialization. It will also get called again if the application calls reinitialize() on the Context.

Implements OpenMM::Integrator.

void OpenMM::VerletIntegrator::step ( int  steps) [virtual]

Advance a simulation through time by taking a series of time steps.

Parameters:
stepsthe number of time steps to take

Implements OpenMM::Integrator.
